summary:
My technical skills are in quantitative interpretation (QI), seismic inversion and seismic processing. Other technical skills are seismic Interpretation and seismic constrained static reservoir modeling. 

My business skills are project management. I have been involved in many projects including, a large-scale project of an integrated, cross-Atlantic software development project and management of a seismic in-house inversion centre.

profile_positions.description: Helping the company with their aspiration of growing their business within the Middle East
profile_positions.title: Advisor (part-time)

profile_positions.description: Project Lead for establishing an improved integrated Exploration & Asset seismic Interpretation working environment. A team was build that successfully initiated the implementation of Virtual IT Work Space, Improved Seismic Data Management practices and upgraded the exploration interpretation IT landscape. This overall realization of the project did help the assessment and acceptance of Shell's newly developed interpretation platform (GeoSigns) in PDO. Support for full deployment of GeoSigns within the rest of the Middle East with focus on replacement of 3rd party seismic interpretation package (Landmark). - Lead the regional workflow support community and deliver user feedback further to the GeoSigns development teams
profile_positions.title: Exploration Workflow Consultant

profile_positions.description: Actively contribute to the design and implementation of the regional and global support model, ao. Build a network of GeoSigns workflow advisors within Middle East and Russia  - A network of GeoSigns workflow advisors in Shell Egypt, SRAK and Qatar Shell has been build. - Transfer of EP domain knowledge to the (regional) IT staff to bring them closer to the business - To help the Middle East GeoSigns project manager (PM) with the technical part of the IT program (EIW) with the focus on integration of workflows, applications and IT infrastructure . Pre-deployment workshops were held in the Shell OU’s and PDO with as deliverables, project plan, funding & resource allocation, assessment of current hardware setup and staff training needs. - Collaborate with the Operating Units (OU’s)/Joint Ventures (JV’s) in the region wrt their migration of the legacy interpretation tool suite (123DI) tools and demonstrate the added value of the EIW program. This will involve OU visits, presenting papers at workshops and conferences, demonstrations and teaching courses, consulting and even taking advantage of multi-media. . The added value of GeoSigns has been demonstrated in Shell Egypt and this has resulted in submission of a highlight to Shell management and papers for conferences. . A number of training classes have been given in PDO and Shell Egypt. - Improve further development and seek synergy between the Exploration and Development workspace. . In my dual role as Exploration & Geophysics and Production Geosciences workflow consultant for the Middle East, I have pro-actively identified potential pittfals followed with solutions within the EIW program and communicated these to regional PM, global Workflow Community, global Program manager.
profile_positions.title: Regional workflow consultant

profile_positions.description: Large part of this assignment is devoted to help shaping the future of Qatar Shell Research & Technology Centre and Qatar Shell Pearl subsurface development teams. It evolved in the inititation, co-ordination and execution of a Datamanagement improvement plan. Furthermore acting as the IT focal point for both teams with the emphasis on monitoring the implementation and testing of the IT infrastructure. For the Pearl project the seismic re-processing has been managed. For the same Pearl project responsible for the acquisition and processing of the Zero-offset VSP's. Theme Lead for seismically constrained reservoir modeling (XStream), thereby responsible for technical context definition and execution. The Middle East focal point for XStream developments and deployment. A research proposal has been written for the application of novel multiple elimination techniques and tests using synthetic seismic data. This research would enable further QI studies for the Pearl project. Detailed seismic to well tie studies has been done for the Qatar Shell projects, Pearl and QatarGas 34 (QG34) which has resulted in recognised improvements in the interpretation. An image enhancement project with Shell's SIPMAP seismic processing has been done for QG34 which has resulted in improved seismic data quality and enabled refined interpretation.
profile_positions.title: QI Geophysicist

profile_positions.description: The initiation and deployment of Shell's integrated reservoir-modeling (IRM) capability, XStream, within the Sakhalin Energy offices. The Quantitative Interpretation (QI) and seismic inversion application to the large-scale Lunskoye IRM project. The aim of this project is to assist in getting better value from the Lunskoye oil and gas development by delivering Integrated Reservoir Model(s). The secondary objective is to demonstrate the value-proposition of XStream.I have been a member of the virtual deployment team for XStream whereby I represented the Lunskoye IRM team and in this role have extensive engagement with the EP R&D teams. I presented a paper on XStream under the title, Challenges for reservoir modeling. How to optimally use seismic in the modeling workflow at the 2004 ISC. The Integrated Subsurface Conference chairpersons recognized this paper as an excellent presentation and as such it is published as an article in the special EP-Journal of Technology in Shell. As a member of Shell’s Jason steering group I act as the global inversion services representative. In this role, I liaise on behalf of the global user community with both Shell subsurface software portfolio management and Fugro-Jason for improvements in the Jason workbench. At regular occasions acting as mentor or coach for inexperienced staff in Integrated QI studies.
profile_positions.title: QI Geophysicist

profile_positions.description: Project management of the Shell R&D project, XStream, an integrated, cross Atlantic software development project encompassing five disciplines i.e. IT, Geology, Geophysics, Reservoir Engineering and Petrophysics. This co-ordination job crossed a broad spectrum of roles, including championing new technology, promoting the project to many disciplines, and engagement with external stakeholders for both leveraging and competitive perspectives. In addition, managing a project for the development of  exchanging stratigraphic reservoir models between the 3rd party packages Petrel, Jason and Shell software.
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Modeling Project Co-ordinator

profile_positions.description:
- Project focal point/ expert for Shell’s seismic image processing and in that role  introduced this technology in Shell Expro. 
- Project manager of the Shell Expro’s in-house seismic inversion centre, ao liaising with Shell research & contractors on technology development and contractual matters.
- R&D focal point for Shell’s proprietary probabilistic inversion, Promise.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Geophysicist
